about.description:
SpectraFit is a command-line and Jupyter-notebook tool for
quick data-fitting based on the regular expression of
distribution functions.
about.summary: Fast fitting of 2D-Spectra with established routines

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "spectrafit" %}
{% set version = "0.12.5" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}-recipe
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/spectrafit-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 86c7d7a8bdadcd031b0cc4133ab381f7ff7883a79fe84093f0b13f63f689f071

build:
  number: 0

outputs:
  - name: {{ name|lower }}
    script: build_base.sh
    build:
      skip: true  # [py<37]
      entry_points:
        - spectrafit = spectrafit.spectrafit:command_line_runner
        - spectrafit-converter = spectrafit.plugins.converter:command_line_runner
    requirements:
      build:
        - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
      host:
        - python
        - pip
      run:
        - python
        - pyyaml >=6.0,<7.0
        - ascii-art >=5.7,<6.0
        - emcee >=3.1.2,<4.0.0
        - lmfit >=1.0.3,<2.0.0
        - numdifftools >=0.9.39,<0.10.0
        - openpyxl >=3.0.9,<4.0.0
        - pydantic >=1.10.1,<2.0.0
        - scikit-learn >=1.0.2,<2.0.0
        - seaborn >=0.11.2,<0.12.0
        - tabulate >=0.8.10,<0.10.0
        - tomli-w >=1.0.0,<2.0.0
        - tomli >=2.0.1,<3.0.0
        - tqdm >=4.64.0,<5.0.0
        - pandas >=1.3.5,<2.0.0
        - numpy >=1.21.6,<2.0.0
        - pydantic >=1.10.1,<2.0.0
    test:
      imports:
        - spectrafit
      commands:
        - spectrafit --help
        - spectrafit-converter --help
  - name: {{ name|lower }}-jupyter
    build:
      noarch: python
      # Skip this package for cross-builds. We will only need a single upload anyways
      skip: true  # [not linux64]
      entry_points:
        - spectrafit-jupyter = spectrafit.app.app:jupyter
    requirements:
      run:
        - {{ pin_subpackage('spectrafit', max_pin='x.x.x') }}
        - jupyterlab >=3.4.5,<4.0.0
        - python-kaleido ==0.2.1
        - itables >=1.3.0,<2.0.0
        - plotly >=5.10.0,<6.0.0
        - dtale >=2.8.1,<3.0.0
    test:
      imports:
        - spectrafit
      commands:
        - spectrafit-jupyter --help
        - python -c "from spectrafit.plugins.notebook import SpectraFitNotebook"
  - name: {{ name|lower }}-all
    build:
      noarch: python
      # Skip this package for cross-builds. We will only need a single upload anyways
      skip: true  # [not linux64]
      entry_points:
        - spectrafit-jupyter = spectrafit.app.app:jupyter
    requirements:
      run:
        - {{ pin_subpackage('spectrafit', max_pin='x.x.x') }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('spectrafit-jupyter', max_pin='x.x.x') }}
    test:
      imports:
        - spectrafit
      commands:
        - spectrafit --help
        - spectrafit-converter --help
        - spectrafit-jupyter --help
        - python -c "from spectrafit.plugins.notebook import SpectraFitNotebook"

about:
  home: https://pypi.org/project/spectrafit/
  summary: Fast fitting of 2D-Spectra with established routines
  description: |
    SpectraFit is a command-line and Jupyter-notebook tool for
    quick data-fitting based on the regular expression of
    distribution functions.
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://anselmoo.github.io/spectrafit/
  dev_url: https://github.com/anselmoo/spectrafit

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - Anselmoo
